content.body: yulia: Goal: The ability to evaluate modules in isolated execution contexts and shared frozen intrinsics, or rather, a foundation on which that can be built.
content.formatted_body: yulia: Goal: The ability to evaluate modules in isolated execution contexts and shared frozen intrinsics, or rather, a foundation on which that can be built.

org.matrix.msc1767.message.body: yulia: Goal: The ability to evaluate modules in isolated execution contexts and shared frozen intrinsics, or rather, a foundation on which that can be built.
yulia: Goal: The ability to evaluate modules in isolated execution contexts and shared frozen intrinsics, or rather, a foundation on which that can be built.

content.body: That’s at least the pretext on which I can conscionably work on this as an Agoric delegate! As a JavaScript user, though, eval-but-for-modules has been a personal goal for a long while now. I proposed a `Module` constructor to TC39 in January of 2010!
content.formatted_body: That’s at least the pretext on which I can conscionably work on this as an Agoric delegate! As a JavaScript user, though, eval-but-for-modules has been a personal goal for a long while now. I proposed a Module constructor to TC39 in January of 2010!

org.matrix.msc1767.message.body: That’s at least the pretext on which I can conscionably work on this as an Agoric delegate! As a JavaScript user, though, eval-but-for-modules has been a personal goal for a long while now. I proposed a `Module` constructor to TC39 in January of 2010!

That’s at least the pretext on which I can conscionably work on this as an Agoric delegate! As a JavaScript user, though, eval-but-for-modules has been a personal goal for a long while now. I proposed a Module constructor to TC39 in January of 2010!
